columns.text: This task asks **why no one is willing to rank the junk bonds.**

A junk bond is a term for debt that is very likely to fail and never be paid. This debt was issued by risky firms in the past that faced a problem of growth industries. Economists consider that if the debt is ranked lower than BB by S&P Moddy's or Ba is part of these highly risky bonds called junk bonds.

Companies are paying rating agencies to have as highest bond rank possible to attract as many investors as possible and give the lowest possible rate of return.

**There is no point in ranking the junk bonds because they are already lower than the investor will accept. The company does not need to pay a rating agency and spend money to get one of the lowest results.**
To answer this question we need to deduce why are junk bonds unrated.

Let's first look at junk bonds and ratings.

**Junk bond** is an **incredibly risky bond with low chances of actually being paid out**, usually due to borrower's struggling finances.

They are, however, high yield (high market interest rate) to compensate for high risk value, so if borrower's finance somehow improve, the return on investment is also high, but again, the prospect is very, VERY risky.

**Rating** is rather self-explanatory. Some relevant body observes bonds and their borrowers/sellers (usually borrowers, as they are the one paying back), look at their financial stability and then determine the reliability of paying the bonds back.

The higher the ranking, the more reliable the pay back will be.

From here, conclusion is very easy. **Junk bond equals low financial stability**. 

Having a junk bond ranked is a very public display of said instability, which is highly reputation damaging. Therefore, it's better to just lay low and give out bonds when the situation stabilizes.

On top of that, since junk bonds are high risk and unreliable, lacking a rank is an immediate notifier that bond is junk, because if it were of higher quality it would have been ranked higher. It doesn't 'deserve' a ranking, as no rank already implies the same thing.
